news.name: news
news.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_news (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "date" DATE, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "image" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "tags" TEXT, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

committee_members.name: committee_members
committee_members.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_committee_members (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "avatar" VARCHAR, "bio" VARCHAR, "bluesky" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "name" VARCHAR, "order" INT, "stem" VARCHAR, "twitch" VARCHAR, "twitter" VARCHAR, "website" VARCHAR, "youtube" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

faq.name: faq
faq.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_faq (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "order" INT, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

media.name: media
media.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_media (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "order" INT, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "year" INT, "youtube_url" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

winners.name: winners
winners.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_winners (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "categories" TEXT, "extension" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "stem" VARCHAR, "year" INT, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

info.name: info
info.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_info (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "ready" BOOLEAN, "structureVersion" VARCHAR, "version" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

props.name: to
props.description: Route Location the link should navigate to when clicked on.

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

path.name: path
path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

props.name: href
props.description: An alias for `to`. If used with `to`, `href` will be ignored

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

path.name: path
path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

props.name: target
props.description: Where to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context.

props.name: rel
props.description: A rel attribute value to apply on the link. Defaults to "noopener noreferrer" for external links.

props.name: prefetchedClass
props.description: A class to apply to links that have been prefetched.

props.name: prefetchOn
props.description: Allows controlling when to prefetch links. By default, prefetch is triggered only on visibility.

props.name: trailingSlash
props.description:
An option to either add or remove trailing slashes in the `href` for this specific link.
Overrides the global `trailingSlash` option if provided.

props.name: activeClass
props.description: Class to apply when the link is active

props.name: exactActiveClass
props.description: Class to apply when the link is exact active

props.name: ariaCurrentValue
props.description: Value passed to the attribute `aria-current` when the link is exact active.

props.name: custom
props.description:
Whether RouterLink should not wrap its content in an `a` tag. Useful when
using `v-slot` to create a custom RouterLink

props.name: external
props.description: Forces the link to be considered as external (true) or internal (false). This is helpful to handle edge-cases

props.name: noRel
props.description: If set to true, no rel attribute will be added to the link

props.name: prefetch
props.description: When enabled will prefetch middleware, layouts and payloads of links in the viewport.

props.name: noPrefetch
props.description: Escape hatch to disable `prefetch` attribute.

props.name: viewTransition
props.description: Pass the returned promise of `router.push()` to `document.startViewTransition()` if supported.

props.name: replace
props.description: Calls `router.replace` instead of `router.push`.

slots.name: default
slots.type: { route: RouteLocationResolvedGeneric; href: string; isActive: boolean; isExactActive: boolean; navigate: (e?: MouseEvent) => Promise<void | NavigationFailure>; } | { href: string; navigate: (e?: MouseEvent) => Promise<void>; prefetch: (nuxtApp?: NuxtApp) => Promise<void>; route: RouteLocationGeneric & { href: string; }; rel: string; target: "_blank" | "_parent" | "_self" | "_top" | (string & {}); isExternal: boolean; isActive: false; isExactActive: false; }

matched.name: matched
matched.description:
Array of {@link RouteRecord} containing components as they were
passed when adding records. It can also contain redirect records. This
can't be used directly. **This property is non-enumerable**.

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

force.name: force

Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive

mods.name: mods
mods.description: Contains the original modules for lazy loaded components.

components.name: components
components.description: Components to display when the URL matches this route. Allow using named views.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

props.name: props
props.description:
Allow passing down params as props to the component rendered by
`router-view`. Should be an object with the same keys as `components` or a
boolean to be applied to every component.

path.name: path
path.description:
Path of the record. Should start with `/` unless the record is the child of
another record.

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

name.name: name
name.description: Name for the route record. Must be unique.

beforeEnter.name: beforeEnter
beforeEnter.description:
Before Enter guard specific to this record. Note `beforeEnter` has no
effect if the record has a `redirect` property.

0.type: (this: undefined, to: RouteLocationNormalizedGeneric, from: RouteLocationNormalizedLoadedGeneric, next: NavigationGuardNext): _Awaitable<...>

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Arbitrary data attached to the record.

validate.name: validate
validate.description:
Validate whether a given route can validly be rendered with this page.

Return true if it is valid, or false if not. If another match can't be found,
this will mean a 404. You can also directly return an object with
statusCode/statusMessage to respond immediately with an error (other matches
will not be checked).

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.
redirect.type: string | ((to: RouteLocationGeneric) => string | RouteLocationAsRelativeGeneric | RouteLocationAsPathGeneric) | { name?: RouteRecordNameGeneric; params?: RouteParamsRawGeneric; path?: unknown; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; } | { path: string; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }

schema.type: string | ((to: RouteLocationGeneric) => string | RouteLocationAsRelativeGeneric | RouteLocationAsPathGeneric) | { name?: RouteRecordNameGeneric; params?: RouteParamsRawGeneric; path?: unknown; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; } | { path: string; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }

schema.2: { name?: RouteRecordNameGeneric; params?: RouteParamsRawGeneric; path?: unknown; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }
schema.3: { path: string; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

keepalive.type: boolean | { include?: MatchPattern; exclude?: MatchPattern; max?: string | number; }

schema.type: boolean | { include?: MatchPattern; exclude?: MatchPattern; max?: string | number; }

schema.2: { include?: MatchPattern; exclude?: MatchPattern; max?: string | number; }

name.name: name
name.description: You may define a name for this page's route.

path.name: path
path.description: You may define a path matcher, if you have a more complex pattern than can be expressed with the file name.

props.name: props
props.description: Allows accessing the route `params` as props passed to the page component.

scrollToTop.name: scrollToTop
scrollToTop.description: Set to `false` to avoid scrolling to top on page navigations

end.name: end
end.description: Should the RegExp match until the end by appending a `$` to it.

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Whether to disallow a trailing slash or not.

component.name: component
component.description: Component to display when the URL matches this route.

0.type: ComponentOptions<any, any, any, ComputedOptions, MethodOptions, any, any, any, string, {}, {}, string, {}, {}, {}, string, ComponentProvideOptions>

head.name: head
head.description:
Available exclusively for `defineNuxtComponent`.
It will not be executed when using `defineComponent`.

2.type: ComponentPublicInstanceConstructor<any, any, any, any, ComputedOptions, MethodOptions>

props.name: props
props.description: {@inheritDoc RouteRecordMultipleViews.props}

enterCallbacks.name: enterCallbacks
enterCallbacks.description: Registered beforeRouteEnter callbacks passed to `next` or returned in guards

instances.name: instances
instances.description:
Mounted route component instances
Having the instances on the record mean beforeRouteUpdate and
beforeRouteLeave guards can only be invoked with the latest mounted app
instance if there are multiple application instances rendering the same
view, basically duplicating the content on the page, which shouldn't happen
in practice. It will work if multiple apps are rendering different named
views.

aliasOf.name: aliasOf
aliasOf.description:
Defines if this record is the alias of another one. This property is
`undefined` if the record is the original one.

fullPath.name: fullPath
fullPath.description:
The whole location including the `search` and `hash`. This string is
percentage encoded.

query.name: query
query.description: Object representation of the `search` property of the current location.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: Hash of the current location. If present, starts with a `#`.

redirectedFrom.name: redirectedFrom
redirectedFrom.description:
Contains the location we were initially trying to access before ending up
on the current location.

matched.name: matched
matched.description:
Array of {@link RouteRecord} containing components as they were
passed when adding records. It can also contain redirect records. This
can't be used directly. **This property is non-enumerable**.

fullPath.name: fullPath
fullPath.description:
The whole location including the `search` and `hash`. This string is
percentage encoded.

query.name: query
query.description: Object representation of the `search` property of the current location.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: Hash of the current location. If present, starts with a `#`.

redirectedFrom.name: redirectedFrom
redirectedFrom.description:
Contains the location we were initially trying to access before ending up
on the current location.

path.name: path
path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

params.name: params
params.description: Object of decoded params extracted from the `path`.

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Merged `meta` properties from all the matched route records.

path.name: path
path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

params.name: params
params.description: Object of decoded params extracted from the `path`.

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Merged `meta` properties from all the matched route records.
